campaign.story:
So this is the 7th installment.  I now have two broad campaigns going, and this includes installments in both.  The Dimgaard campaign is an XP driven campaign, and we're at 8th level, so here are the 7th level adventures that we played last month (polished up with sidebars and whatnot).  Here is the first of the five as a preview: http://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/153614/DG26-Greenville
The Drow Conspiracy Saga is a milestone, fast advancement campaign - one adventure per level.  And we're on adventure 11.  1-7 were in previous kickstarters, so here are DC8, DC9, and DC10.
There is a new 1st level Dimgaard adventure that I used for a group of new players recently, and I wanted an additional 1st level adventure to square of the 1st level adventures in the Dimgaard series; there were only 3 1st level adventures, while every other block has at least four.
There is also an encounter gallery for 7th level PCs.  These are encounters that serve specific function (Inquisition, or retaliations), or single events that are not part of the storyline.  
Here are the blurbs (which may revise on final edits):
DG26 Greenville: Odill is a large city where corruption is rampant. And there are numerous strong organizations vested in preventing reform. Even with a regime change, the Cult of Orcus destroyed, and the drug cartels damaged, the reform of Odill seems a Herculean challenge. Maybe it is time for a different strategy. A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 7th level characters. The first episode in the Villages of Odill Arc.
DG27 Shaky Alliance: The communities around Odill are not natural allies. Each was established around different philosophies and work to protect its niche in the economy of greater Odill. Forging them into a political block capable of challenging the overshadowing power of Odill is no trivial task. A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 7th level adventurers. The second episode in the Villages of Odill Arc. 
DG28 The Question: Slavery has a history that predates humanity. However, many organizations view it as an oppressive and inherently evil institution that should be opposed at every turn. Some even believe that it is worth any sacrifice to overthrow it. It the divisive issue between the Odill villages that agree with reform and those that support Prince Priogrim. Can the PCs keep the Odill region from exploding in civil strife? A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 7th level characters. The third episode in the Villages Of Odill Arc.
DG29 Allies in Trouble: The Order of Tythia was inspired by the alliance’s determination to reform Odill. With the help of the Order of Metal and the Olidammarans, the Tythians tried to inspire a wave of slave rebellions in the agricultural communities, but failed. And during the attempt several were captured and are in the custody of Prince Priogrim. Can the PCs save their allies? A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 7th level characters. The fourth episode of the Villages of Odill Arc.
DG30 Crusade: Things are coming to a head in the rivalry between Odill and its surrounding communities. With both sides nearly evenly matched, the heroes give the edge to Odill’s opposition. But Odill’s position as the most influential city in the area and the seat of the Inquisition gives it an option with dramatic consequences. A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 7th level characters. The fifth and final episode in the Villages of Odill Arc.
DGS14 Natural Balance: One person’s dedicated defense of an ideal is another person’s terrorism. What happens when progress endangers the natural order – or even nature itself? Can the PCs resolve the differences between the naturalists and the crafters? A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 1st level PCs.
DC8 War Against the Drow: An agreement reached between the orcs of Fhuu and their neighbors for a coordinated campaign against the Drow Empire. Reserves mustered, weapons sharpened, armor polished – what could go wrong. A D&D 5th edition adventure for 8th level characters; the eighth episode in the Drow Conspiracy Epic.
DC9 Drow Island: The campaign against St. Aurelius was thwarted. It is clear that the drow are an imposing force. Rather than an attack on St. Aurelius, a penetration behind aimed at a drow base might have more success. A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 9th level characters. The ninth episode in the Drow Conspiracy Epic.
DC10 Liberation from the Drow: If the capitol (St. Aurelius) can be liberated, it likely would trigger a widespread revolt that the drow could not resist without aid from their Abyssal resources. But the drow cannot draw from their Abyssal resources – at least for a while. So St. Aurelius is prime for a counterstrike to free it from the yoke of the drow. A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 10th level characters. The tenth episode in the Drow Conspiracy Epic.

At the moment it looks like there are three backers signed up for the Aug 29 Roll20 session, and there is room for 8.  So  you can message me, email me, or post a comment and I'll hold a place for you there.

We hit the $1200 stretch goal.  Great!!!  I'll be running a roll20.net session from 2-10 PM Central on Aug 29.  I can handle up to 8 players.  So first 8 backers to notify me that they want to participate are in.
Also, we're closing in on $1300.  So at $1400, since I wold be revising the maps for the villages and cities, I'll also add character portraits for each of the notable NPCs.

We are closing in on $1,200, and that is great; thanks to all the backers.  So the suggestion has been put forth that as the next stretch goal, I improve the maps for the cities and villages.  And it is true, that I was rather lazy (or efficient, depending on perspective) in that I used village maps I had found around the web, rather than create new unique ones.  Additionally, I'm kind of wanting to get more comfortable with CC3. 
So at $1,300, I'll commit to replacing the city and village maps in the Dimgaard campaign with unique ones.  Note that the Drow Conspiracy series uses three quite excellent city maps that I'm quite happy with, though, and I don't think I can improve on these.  I doubt this will be complete by the KS end, but it should be complete by the end of August.

Coming back from GenCon with a couple of quite smart friends of mine, they suggested that I add more to my kickstarters implying that I had been lazy and a little selfish.  So to involve and inspire more backers, I've added a couple of reward tiers that I hope some backers will find appealing.
And here's the stretch goals.  
If we get to $1000, the Encounter Galleries are only available through the kickstarters.  They are not published on drivethrurpg.  The idea is that the DM has these ready for each session.  Sometimes sessions run unexpectedly short, or the PCs go in an unexpected direction, or a DM wants a "random encounter", and the DM needs a level appropriate encounter that is flexible enough to add to any of the stories.  For this kickstarter, there is a legendary (Hogir), a legendary (Itark), and a legendary (Sultur).  At $1,000, I'll add a legendary to the mix.

Some people has messaged me asking what is going on with all the revisions.
Short answer, I'm going through all the previous adventures and updating them with things that I've learned and the help of an editor.  I think I'll have them all updated by the end of August.
Longer answer...

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

What are the risks and challenges that come with completing your project, and how are you qualified to overcome them?

For a project like ours, the risks and challenges fall into three categories: 
1) Overall Non-completion 
2) Delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates 
3) We do not produce a specific model or change a specific model.

Concerning the risk of Overall Non-completion: we've already completed two massive Kickstarters and are fully aware of the pitfalls. Two things that could cause the non-completion of this Kickstarter are either the loss of our inbound shipments (due to an act of God, pirates or war), or a massive disaster (fire, flood) that levels our facility. Either of those events might be disastrous, however we carry full insurance on our facility and insure every shipment, no matter the size, against loss and damage.

Obviously either of the above tragic events would create delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates, and that brings us to the second category: delays. We learned a lot during our two Kickstarters. However, delays are simply part of the cycle of business and it is our wisdom, training, and experience that would help us mitigate and work through any delay. Some delays are easy to solve, such as replacing a printer that is creating barcodes that a particular USPS hub is having a problem reading. Other delays are out of our hands, such as the 2014-2015 longshoreman west coast work slow down that delayed all of our overseas containers. We have even intentionally created delays when we chose to change models already in production to make them better.

Lastly there is the risk we will not produce a specific model shown. This will only occur if there is not enough interest in a specific model measured by the number of backers that actually pledge for to buy it verses the cost to produce it. This event did not occur in either of our previous Kickstarters, but is nonetheless still a risk. In the event this situation develops we will issue a refund or credit depending on your desire for the buy in pledge amount of the model.

We reserve the right to modify pieces shown to meet production requirements.

In summary we have the knowledge, wisdom and know how to prevent, solve, and work through just about any problem that we will face and will do everything possible to make this an exciting and enjoyable event.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thanks everyone for a great Kickstarter! The final product is better for your participation. Our Fifth Edition Fantasy line will end up with four new adventures based on this Kickstarter - when we only planned for two. Thanks for clearing all those stretch goals! It's been a blast and we really appreciate your support.
If you missed the Kickstarter, you can visit our web site for more information on pre-orders. 
And for those who didn't already see it, here is the cover art for Fifth Edition Fantasy #5: Into the Dragon's Maw, one of the stretch goal modules you helped create! The other one is Fifth EditionFantasy #6: Fantastic Encounters, a book of drop-in encounters.
Cover art for our Free RPG Day module!
Goodman Games is very excited to support the world’s first fantasy role playing game in its fifth edition! This Kickstarter expands our ongoing Fifth Edition Fantasy line with two new adventure modules, and possibly a third for Free RPG Day!
Goodman Games is the only third party publisher to continuously support Dungeons & Dragons in every edition since 3E. Since the earliest days of the Open Game License and D20 License, we have published compatible materials for 3.0, 3.5, and 4E – and even the occasional 1E module as a convention special. And now it’s time for 5E!
Summary of Kickstarter:
This Kickstarter funds the publication of two adventure modules for our Fifth Edition Fantasy line. With stretch goals, we would also like to give backers a third adventure from our Free RPG Day release.
The format for our Fifth Edition Fantasy modules is short, 16- to 32-page modules playable in a few sessions. They are stand-alone, world-neutral, and easy to integrate into your ongoing campaign.
Depending on funding levels and stretch goals cleared, the adventures may be enhanced with additional content, including bonus encounters and setting material.
Finally, we would like your feedback on what YOU want for Fifth Edition. We invite backers to comment on what they would like Goodman Games to publish for our next 5E Kickstarter!
Cover Art to the Fifth Edition Fantasy Line
  Fifth Edition Fantasy is Here!
Our new line of 5E modules is called simply Fifth Edition Fantasy. Authored by well-known adventure designers Michael Curtis and Chris Doyle (each with more than a dozen published adventures under his belt), these adventures combine the streamlined game mechanics of 5E with challenging scenarios explicitly designed to appeal to both long-time gamers and neonates alike. Each adventure includes new races, backgrounds, monsters, spells, and magical items suitable for any 5E campaign.
What are the goals of this Kickstarter? We have four goals with this Kickstarter:
1. Launch the next two Fifth Edition Fantasy modules. These are FEF #3: The Pillars of Pelagia (by Chris Doyle) and FEF #4: War-lock (by Michael Curtis). Depending on stretch goals achieved, they may be expanded with new encounters and even more content.
2. Offer our first two 5E adventures to Kickstarter backers. If you haven’t already purchased them from your local store, you can add on to your pledge with the second printings of FEF #1: Glitterdoom (by Michael Curtis) and FEF #2: The Fey Sisters’ Fate (by Chris Doyle).
3. Listen to your feedback on 5E. Each edition of Dungeons & Dragons is different, with different player and DM needs. As you support this Kickstarter, we’d love to hear what you want from us in our next 5E project.
4. Give away a free 5E module on Free RPG Day. Yes, you read that right! The ultimate stretch goal for this Kickstarter is to create an entirely new adventure, which will be free to all backers and also printed for free distribution on Free RPG Day! Fifth Edition Fantasy #5 – for free! That’s 5 F words in the tagline and the last is “free” – has a good ring to it, don’t you think?
Sample interior illustration from The Pillars of Pelagia
Tell Me About the Adventures! 
Certainly! The Goodman Games web site is updated with detailed information on each printed adventure, including some previews and early reviews. Here are links with art, previews, reviews, and more information:
Fifth Edition Fantasy #1: Glitterdoom
Fifth Edition Fantasy #2: The Fey Sisters’ Fate
Fifth Edition Fantasy #3: The Pillars of Pelagia
Fifth Edition Fantasy #4: War-lock
How long will these take to write? The adventures are already written and edited. All maps and interior art are complete, and layout will begin the moment this Kickstarter concludes and we know how much bonus content we can print. Goodman Games has a strong track record of delivering on our promises, and this Kickstarter will continue that record.
How can I support the Kickstarter? You can pledge for the adventure modules, of course! Our pledge levels allow for funding of the two new Fifth Edition Fantasy modules, plus add-ons of the two already-published Fifth Edition Fantasy modules.
What makes our adventures special? After publishing more than 100 modules continuously for over a decade, Goodman Games has developed a reputation for a clear perspective on fantasy adventure:
Our adventure content focuses on unique encounters with unexpected dangers, memorable scenes that conjure strong visuals in the players’ minds, and non-clichéd plots.
Our modules are meant to be played, not just to be read. They are structured as short adventures designed to be gamed “in real life” over a few sessions. You can fit these adventures into your busy lifestyle.
Our adventures are designed to be great adventures – and not something else. You won’t find our adventures to be thinly veiled attempts to publish an appendix of “crunchy bits.” Sure, we include some new material, but our primary goal is to ensure that you and your friends have fun playing the adventure. You’ll walk away with great memories of your game sessions. That’s our promise and that’s what we deliver on.
Our writers are battle-tested and experienced, and it shows in the content. We know that running a published adventure is different from running one of your own creation. You’ll find it easy to integrate our modules into your campaigns because we know how to keep them world-neutral, stand-alone, and easy to ramp up fast.
All of our adventures are playtested thoroughly before publication. We believe they play as well or better than how they read. The adventures for this Kickstarter were written months ago, and were playtested long before the Kickstarter was launched. We’re not “racing against the Kickstarter” to write the adventures. 
Sample interior illustration from War-Lock
What support is offered? “This isn’t our first rodeo,” as the old saying goes. Having published adventures for the third and fourth editions of the game, we’ve learned a few things. Here’s what you can expect as a buyer of our 5E products:
Download codes in print products: All of our 5E adventures include a printed code that allows you to download a PDF edition of the module. This allows us to keep the electronic edition current, and you can receive any update seamlessly. (Note: The codes in our first two modules were unfortunately posted to an online pirate site, so future modules will feature randomized codes different in each copy. If you find the download codes from the first two modules don’t work for you, please email us for assistance.)
Continuous updates: As we learned publishing modules in the transition from 3.0 to 3.5, and the later revisions to 4E, the game can evolve in a way that makes earlier material less relevant. We will update the PDF editions of our modules to stay current (as we have already done with the PDF editions of our first two 5E modules). As a print purchaser, you have ongoing access to these PDF updates.
Multiple printings: Our adventures have always proven quite popular, and frequently sell out. Whenever we reprint an adventure, we do another editorial pass to correct any minor typos, rules updates, or updated playtest feedback. For the first two 5E modules, you’ll be receiving the second printing, which is already updated with revisions from the first printing.
Ongoing support: Have a question or comment? You can find us. Over more than a decade we have built a reputation for responsiveness to customers. And we love to game with you at cons! Last year, you could find our crew at DunDraCon, TotalCon, Coscon, GaryCon, MepaCon, ConGlomeration, North Texas RPG Convention, Origins, DexCon, KantCon, Gen Con, Tacticon, Pacificon, GrandCon, Necronomicon, Con on the Cob, Gamehole Con, TsunamiCon, U-Con, Post-Apocalypticon, and Marmalade Dog. You’ll find us on the con circuit again this year. Come game with us! And if you have a local con we missed, let us know!
One of the maps from War-Lock (players, avert your eyes!)
Stretch Goals
Help us make these modules even more awesome! With sufficient funding, we intend to expand our FEF line with a bunch of new stretch goals. Here's the confirmed and still-to-be-decided stretch goals:
FIRST STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! Starting at $7,000, we will expand Fifth Edition Fantasy #3: The Pillars of Pelagia with several new encounters. These encounters give the PCs more interesting places and creatures to encounter as they explore the adventure site. At $7000 and each $1000 thereafter we will add in one of the five new encounters:
Area 2-2: The Winding Path STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! AREA ADDED!
Area 2-3: Morella’s Lair STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! AREA ADDED!
Area 3-4: The Laboratory STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! AREA ADDED!
Area 4-4: The Dock STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! AREA ADDED!
Area 4-5: The Hidden Grotto STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! AREA ADDED!
SECOND STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! Starting at $12,000, we will expand Fifth Edition Fantasy #4: War-lock with additional encounters. At $12000 and each $1000 thereafter we will add in new material as follows:
Approximately 10 short random wilderness encounters in the hex-crawl through the badlands STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! ENCOUNTERS ADDED!
Two additional monster lairs in the final series of encounters STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! MONSTER LAIRS ADDED!
A full map and description for the Rusted Gorgon Inn STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! THE INN IS ADDED!
A mini-gazetteer of the badlands hex-crawl with new locations, lairs, mini-dungeons, outlaw hideouts, and other such things. STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! THE MINI GAZETTEER IS ADDED!
THIRD STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! At $15,000, we are adding Fifth Edition Fantasy #5: Into The Dragon’s Maw! This entirely new adventure will be added for Free RPG Day release nationwide. All backers will receive a free PDF, with an option to add on the print edition for +$10. (It’s free on Free RPG Day if you live near a participating store, of course!)
FOURTH STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! All 7 handouts added! At $18,000, we are adding additional player handouts to Fifth Edition Fantasy #3: Pillars of Pelagia – up to 7 handouts depending on funding level.  Longtime D&D fans surely remember the classic book of handouts from Tomb of Horrors. Something like that is our goal here.
And for every 50 backers, we are adding a free drop-in encounter! Drop-in encounters were a clear “favorite” in our unofficial survey, right up there behind adventures. For every 50 backers, we’ll publish a new drop-in encounter useful for any 5E campaign: encounters while traveling on a road, while camping, while at an inn, while in a castle, while exploring the underdark, etc. All backers will receive a PDF copy of this new product, Fifth Edition Fantasy: Fantastic Encounters! (tentative title, may change) 
As we update this on May 23, we have 574 backers, so the Fantastic Encounters product will include at least 11 new encounters. And that number will grow as we add more backers.
And what's past that? Let's see how the Kickstarter does - and see what other cool ideas you have for adding to it! It certainly seems reasonable to add on a print edition of Fifth Edition Fantasy: Fantastic Encounters...
Shipping & Handling
For US customers, shipping and handling is a flat $5 whether you order one module or all four. 
For international customers, shipping and handling charges will be invoiced at the end of the Kickstarter. International postage can vary widely, and this process allows us to give you the best price for your order. We will invoice the orders via Paypal when items are ready to ship. Here are estimated shipping costs, depending on number of items ordered: Canada $10-$14; Europe, Australia, and rest of world: $13-$20
Fifth Edition Fantasy is here, and this is your chance to be part of it from the beginning. We appreciate your support!

The walls of Endhome provide sanctuary for many who dwell on the Sinnar Coast: a place to conduct trade, a warm bed at night, and a fire to sit beside with a jack of ale into the late hours of the evening, but across the Gaelon River lies chaos.
The Lost Lands Return!
First introduced with the Lost City of Barakus Kickstarter, the Sinnar Coast region map detailed thousands of square miles of territory stretching from Rappan Athuk in the north all the way to the Domain of Hawkmoon far to the south. While many locations on the map are familiar from old Necromancer Games titles and more recent Frog God Games products, the map itself did little to tell the story of this region and even less to answer questions that it raised: Who rules beyond the Gaelon River? What hazards and ruins await south of the well-known dungeons of Rappan Athuk and Barakus? And, what has led to this land becoming known as the Sundered Kingdoms?
As part of the ongoing strategy of Frog God Games to take older and hard-to-find Necromancer Games products and update them not only to new Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and Swords & Wizardry Complete rules but also to incorporate them into the Lost Lands setting as a way to introduce them to fans old and new alike, Cults of the Sundered Kingdoms takes three classic Necromancer Games adventures: Patrick Lawinger’s Morrick Mansion, Casey W. Christofferson’s Aberrations, and Dave Brohman’s Crystal Skull and integrates them into a continuous plot for an adventure path that takes PCs from level 3 to 15+, perfect for the party that has finished exploring the dungeons beneath Barakus and is looking for the next road to adventure.
But Cults of the Sundered Kingdoms is much more than just an update of those three previously published adventures. To the adventure path it adds three new original adventures written by Greg A. Vaughan called The Beast Within, Shades of Yellow, and Vengeance in the Hollow Hills that both tie in with the three older adventures and also move the plot from one to the next to create the continuity of the adventure path. While you could play any or all of the six adventures as standalone sessions, you can also use them as a single contiguous campaign to explore a large region of the Lost Lands.
The First Lost Lands Gazetteer
In addition to the updated and expanded adventure path, Cults of the Sundered Kingdoms includes a campaign guide that expands upon the regional map of the Sinnar Coast. The central portion of that regional map is called the District of Sunderland, known more colloquially as the Sundered Kingdoms. Cults of the Sundered Kingdoms includes a full-color poster map that focuses on the Sundered Kingdoms from Endhome in the north to the southern extent of the Duchy of Southvale in the south, from Grollek’s Grove in the west to the farthest reaches of Ramthion Island in the east. The adventure path takes players from one end to the other with many a stop in between, but the included gazetteer details the dozens of nations, cities, wilderness areas, ethnicities, and geographic features of note within the area as well. It also provides a regional history including more global events of the Lost Lands that had a direct bearing on the area, giving the first sneak peak at the Lost Lands bigger picture hinted at and referenced throughout more than 15 years of Necromancer Games and Frog God Games products alike. This detailed history and timeline extends back more than 3,000, years telling the history of not only a significant portion of the Lost Lands but also the unknown back stories to classic Necromancer Games products.
Finally the Cults of the Sundered Kingdoms campaign guide also includes a chapter dedicated to the 13 insidious cults that are endemic to the Sundered Kingdoms region and are, perhaps, the true reason for its centuries of strife. This guide includes not only a write up of some of the most iconic and some not-so-well-known evil powers of the Lost Lands (yes, Orcus and Tsathogga are both there…along with 11 others) but also provides details of their individual cults, where they are located, and how they operate in and affect the Sundered Kingdoms as well as the rest of the Lost Lands.
Old School Bonus!
And as one more bonus for those old-time Necromancer Games fans (and new Frog God Games fans!) who followed all the releases in order to maintain a complete collection — even the hard-to-find stuff — we’ve got something you’ve never seen before. When Crystal Skull was first published back in 2005, a secret level was written as bonus material but was never released. We’ve dug back through the Necromancer Games archives and uncovered this gem; we’ve dusted it off, updated its rules, and incorporated it into the book so that it now serves as the climax of the entire adventure path! Now on the 10th anniversary of its original release, you can experience Crystal Skull as Orcus originally intended but with the bonus of it serving to cap off an entire campaign incorporating three classic Necromancer Games adventures, three brand new adventures, and a whole host of Lost Lands legends, lore, and deepest, darkest secrets.
Be the master of your Lost Lands campaign; buy The Lost Lands: Cults of the Sundered Kingdoms and remind your players that there’s more to fear in the Lost Lands than just the dungeons.

Written by Lost Lands alum Kevin Wright (The Mires of Mourning, The Northlands Saga Complete) and newcomer Lost Lands fans Arlan Bullard, Rick McCracken, Jeff Provine, and Nathan Shank, these short stories look at some of the most important and interesting characters and events in the Sundered Kingdoms and give you the official story. Risks and challenges
Our only foreseeable risk is if our production facility gets backlogged. Our printer is a large producer of college text books and yearbooks, so depending on the time of year they can have a suddenly busy production schedule. We have been using them for our big books for the last 5 years, and they have always been reliable, but if our order gets caught in a text or yearbook crush it can cause delays in the printing. This has not been a problem to date but is always a remote possibility, and we wanted to be transparent with you about it.

Less likely risks include but are not necessarily limited to: (1) one or more asteroid(s) making violent contact with the planetary crust, and causing a dust cloud blanketing out the sun; (2) a direct meteor strike on a Kickstarter-related production facility, including but not limited to computers, power stations required therefor, alien overlords thereof, and other potential but unknown un-, sub-, or supernatural forces required for the operation of Kickstarter, Amazon, their controlling entities, the controlling entities, thereof, and ultimately the Illuminati or the Knights Templar, as applicable; (3) invasions or incursions in force by cannibalistic humanoids and/or morlocks traveling in time, leading to disruptions in urban transportation, offloading, and/or dispatching operations; (4) printing operations initially tasked to the Kickstarter’s fulfillment being diverted to production of bodice-ripping romance novels, teen vampire romances, or refrigerator user manuals; (5) various individuals up and down the production chain being struck individually, sequentially, severally, or simultaneously by train(s) and/or other such devices; (6) no members of the company have admitted to being in a tontine, so there’s that; (7) disappearance in Amazon rainforests by employees, subcontractors, or freelancers of Wizards of the Coast LLC, whether or not related to those rumors concerning dinosaur rodeos and actual owlbear experiments; (8) Ebola goes aerosol: kiss it all goodbye, people; (9) rust monsters loose in the metal; (10) tectonic shifts; (11) Greenwood captured by fans for extended bacchanal; (12) time-travel paradoxes instigated by third parties; (13) the wrong butterfly flaps its wings in the wrong damn place.

campaign.story:
Well you've helped us blast through all the stretch goals and then some. Thank you all for helping us bring this classic back into print. I know both Ernie and Luke are very excited!
Ernest Gary Gygax Jr. and Luke Gygax's
20K Preludes
Preludes sets the stage for Gaxmoor and the world of Aihrde. It has adventuring material, fiction and other sundries. All these will be fleshed out and expanded. To give you a taste, here is the tale of the Haunted Valley.
19K Behind the Curtain
Stephen Chenault pulls back the curtain from way back in 2001 and relates the store of how the contracts with Gary Gygax, Ernie and Luke Gygax, Aihrde, the Canting Crew and Gaxmoor all came tumbling together!
18K Luke Gygax
Long long ago, when the Lost City was first explored there were many teasers about the Undercaverns. But no one knew exactly what. But in conversations with Luke, it seems he's a bit anxious to explore them....his adventure, assuming we hit the 18k goal, will be a nice intro piece to what lies beneath the Lost City of Gaxmoor!
Help us take a peek into what lies beneath....
BEER MUG STRETCH!
What would an Ernie and Luke Gygax game be without a beer mug!! We've decided to add more drinkware to your gaming habits! IF we hit 100 backers at the $59.00 pledge level we'll include a FREE beer mug in the $59.00 (and above) package! Complete with logo!
Logo on the Tshirt!!
14K James M. Ward
We are only a few hundred away from unleashing the Wizard from Wisconsin: James M. Ward! He'll add his considerable talent to the fray with a smashing adventure! Print copy available at 59+!
10K Secret Door Open
You've just opened the secret door! Trollzah. Now begins an ever greater treatment of Gaxmoor. We'll select three of the more prominent Areas in Gaxmoor and create Isometric maps for them. These maps, rendered by Del Teigeler will include room contents as well, making the CK's job all the easier. Also, we'll incorporate Jake Parker and Sean King's ideas, allowing for plenty of room for CK notes. The below sample is what we have in mind: 
NEXT GOAL 11K
We've hit the hard cover. We've hit the 18 x 22 inch map sewn in the book. We've hit the additional intro adventure. Now we are up against the Map Book! Your going to want this. With a separate book the CK/GM can access maps far easier and use them as displays during game play. And, it puts us one step closer to the Isometric Map of Gaxmoor!
Though all these maps are slated to be redone, this is a sample map form the original Gaxmoor and the treatment Peter Bradley is giving it:
ABOUT GAXMOOR
Fifteen years ago Troll Lord Games -- fresh in the RPG market -- joined with Ernest Gary Gygax Jr. and his brother Luke Gygax, to bring to life their amazing city, The Lost City of Gaxmoor. The city, caught up in the ruins of time and under the heels of chaos, proved an instant hit and helped place TLG firmly in the RPG market.
Going out of print when TLG moved away from d20, the Lost City returned to the brothers Gygax, where it sat in quiet retirement, leaving only the memories of many blood-soaked adventure hours.
But now, after many years, the Lost City returns to the Troll Dens! This time, under the Castles & Crusades banner!
The Lost City unleashes all the wild imaginings of the brothers Gygax, bringing them to your gaming table! A seamless blend of the old world's iron grinding action and the Siege Engine, Gaxmoor promises an epic montage of wreck and ruin.
Introduction by Frank Mentzer!
FUNDING GOALS: The Lost City of Gaxmoor is a 120 page book, scheduled to release as a softcover book with the sprawling city map divided up into 8.5 x 11 sheets and set within the book. But it needs a far better treatment.  TLG's goals with this are to bring it out in hardcover format and to release the city map in a full color, 18 x 22 inch poster. Our basic goal is to hit a hardcover book, but the stretch rewards will build the project into so much more!
Join us! Join the Fray! Bring The Lost City of Gaxmoor back to the gaming table in all the glory the wealth of its adventure deserves!
EARLY BIRD: THE EARLY BIRD OPTION IS CLOSED. The first 187 backers have locked in the EARLY BIRD. Trollzah! All early bird backers receive a soft cover edition of the Lost City of Gaxmoor. You must back the 25.00 pledge level or above. This copy ships with your kickstarter package unless you are at GARY CON VII. All Early Bird backers receive a digital copy at Kickstarter close.
NOTE ON PLEDGE LEVELS, ADD ONS and STRETCH REWARDS: In previous Kickstarters, we've counted a pledger's add ons toward their total Pledge Level. So if you pledge 25.00 and bought 25.00 dollars in Add Ons, we counted your over all Pledge as a 50 Pledge Level. If this edged you toward the next pledge level, you earned the Stretch Rewards from that higher level. Sadly, this policy, as cool as it is, has wreaked havoc in the Dens. It's caused payment confusion, mis-shipped orders, delayed orders and overall frustration from the pledger and hair pulling frustration from the shipping department here. So with that in mind, we are, sadly, going to place the emphasis on your pledge level. If you pledge at Pledge Level X, we will only ship the Stretch Rewards applied to that Pledge Level. If you want the next Pledge Level's Stretch Rewards, bumping up your Pledge Level is easy enough. The add on list will be included in the Kickstarter, but only as an add on. Apologies all around for the confusion, delay and changes.
Proposed Tee Shirt Designs: Take a look, then go here to vote for your favorite! 
 STRETCH GOALS EXPLAINED
$4,500: Achieved! The Lost City of Gaxmoor achieves the treatment it deserves. We print it in hardback.
$7,000: Achieved! We release the city map in full color, on an 18" x 22" poster. Stitched inside of the book. Pledge levels $25 and up.
$9,000: Achieved! If you're a fan of Aihrde -- or just need a start up adventure -- Stephen Chenault of Castles & Crusades, pens a wild tale to get you started. This adventure promises to bring the world and the city together like never before.  Digital for levels $25 and up; Print and Digital for $59 and up.
$10,000 Secret Door: Achieved!  We'll select three of the more prominent Areas in Gaxmoor and create Isometric maps for them. Print and Digital for $59 and up.
$11,000: Achieved! The Lost City has dozen of maps. These maps remain in the book, but we'll produce a separate booklet for quick use.  Digital for levels $25 and up; Print and Digital for $59 and up.
$12,000 Secret Door: Achieved! We'll select three more of the more prominent Areas in Gaxmoor and create Isometric maps for them. Print and Digital for $59 and up.
$13,000: Achieved! Isometric Map of Gaxmoor. This map brings Gaxmoor to life like nothing else! It will look something along the lines of this map of Bergholt. Digital copy for $25 and below, print and digital copies for 59+.
$14,000 Gaxmoor Adventure: Achieved! James M. Ward joins the fray and pens a module adventure that fits in the Lost City. Digital copy for $25 and below, print and digital copies for 59+.
$16,000 Sewers Achieved!: Peter Bradley plunges into the sewers of Gaxmoor, mapping out the template supplied by Ernest and Luke Gygax!
$18,000 Luke Gygax Returns to Gaxmoor Achieved: Luke has agreed to pen a new piece for Gaxmoor. Digital copy for $25 and below, print and digital copies for 59+.
$19,000 Behind the Curtain Achieved: Stephen Chenault details all the history of the original publication, the story of how and why Gary Gygax wrote a short adventure for the original Codex of Erde, how the brothers Gygax met the brothers Chenault and some of the early tales of Milwaukee mishaps. Digital copy for $25 and below, print and digital copies for 59+.
$20,000 Preludes Achieved: Stephen Chenault expands upon the Gary Con special release, with all the connective tissue between Gaxmoor and the world of Aihrde. The tales, the adventures, the setting. Bring it all  home!
$21,000 Secret Door Achieved: We'll select three more of the more prominent Areas in Gaxmoor and create Isometric maps for them. Print and Digital for $59 and up.
$25 Isometric Map Pack:  You get the Isometric Map of Gaxmoor and the 6 Iso maps.

Risks and challenges
Large books such as this one are hard to print and bind and we have to choose our printers with care.

One of the greatest challenges we face is creating such a large book and maintaining the quality of the printing and binding. In order to do this, we must find a printer with the knowledge and capabilities to execute a book of this size and have it look polished and professional, something we take great pride in. This will cost more than usual printing so Kickstarter becomes essential in raising enough capital to give this book the quality it demands and deserves.

We are confident that with a successful Kickstarter we can bring this product to the world not only as a great resource, but also as a great looking book.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
My goal is to raise funds for typesetting fees to create Step-by-Step PDF tutorials.  These tutorials will provide blueprints for building structures in the popular block building game by Mojang that can be used as visual aids in Role Playing Games such as D&D or Pathfinder.
The need to add a third dimension to your flat battlemats, using more than just miniatures is a reality for anyone who has ever tried to DM a campaign for a less-than-hardcore role-playing group. 
Let’s face it, some players just lack the creative imagination to visualize your epic dungeons, mansions, towers, keeps, and wide open worlds without visual aids.  How can you bring the catacombs beneath your castle to life as well as in your players’ minds?  Sure – you could spend hundreds or perhaps thousands of dollars on 3D models or costly digital tools, but in the end - all you really need is a simple way in which to convey your vision to the players.  How can you solve this dilemma on a limited budget?
Enter the poor man’s version of a 3D sandbox known as MCEdit; a free world editor for Minecraft™.  Using MCEdit, you can reproduce your 2D tabletop map into the stunning 3D visuals you conjured up in your head.  From using simple screenshots as visual reference, to running an entire campaign - the choice is yours for how immerse you use this tool to enhance the play experience of your group.
The tutorials include easy-to-follow instructions to build structures one row of blocks at a time as well as a completed 3D model compatible with MCEdit.
If successfully funded, I will use any additional funding to produce even more tutorials, as well as giving anyone who pledges $20 or more great stretch goal rewards to say thank you!
With your help, anything is possible.  Please join me on this Kickstarter and thanks for your support!
As a reward for reading this far I am offering a free sample tutorial for this Kickstarter campaign only.  This sample includes the Step-by-Step tutorial + digital model to build a small Outpost Fortress as shown below.  Click here to download the file.
With less than two weeks left to go I wanted to post an update about this Kickstarter. The funding has been a roller coaster ride so far and it seems to have attracted more Minecraft players/builders than RPG Dungeon Masters. I’m glad I posted a link to download the Outpost Fortress for free so that anyone choosing to support my Kickstarter knows exactly what this Kickstarter is about. According to Google Analytic's the Outpost Fortress file has received over 2500+ downloads, yet funding for the project has remained stagnate. That’s not surprising, everyone enjoys something for free and I hope those who are able to download it during this campaign find it useful.
I've received a lot of private messages from people interested in the pre-built town so I've decided to add an additional pledge level for those who are only looking for a pre-built scenario to use. Of course, anyone who has pledged $20 or more toward this Kickstarter will also receive all the items offered in this new pledge level. Check out the video below to see a fly through of the Bonus Village available to anyone who pledges $4 or more toward my Kickstarter.
BONUS VILLAGE
PLAY

This new pre-built village will not include the modular walls or instructional PDF’s on how to build each structure brick by brick. It does include an Archery Range, Windmill, Waterwheel, Bridge, and various other raised barricades. In addition, for the Dungeon Masters, I will include a copy of my custom Pathfinder adventure “The Alchemist Ruse” that I sale on RPGNow at no additional cost.
For more information about the Pathfinder adventure go to: http://www.rpgnow.com/product/129551/The-Alchemist-Ruse
If successfully funded, I will use any additional funding to produce even more tutorials, as well as giving anyone who pledges $20 or more great stretch goal rewards to say thank you!

If there are any delays in production I will keep everyone informed. You have my full commitment if you choose to support my kickstarter project.

campaign.story:
"I saw their product demo in person at Origins and I was blown away. Very professional, well put together, extremely functional." - Bryan Stiltz, Production Manager, Reaper Miniatures
"I liked the scenario because right from the beginning it encouraged players to move forward without pulling out their weapons. To me that’s good game-craft because later on it allows the GM more options." - Erik Wecks, Geekdad
"The actual encounters are really well done. This is a thinking player’s adventure, where most of the encounters are tricks and traps, and really inventive tricks at that." - Merric's Musings
Download a free sample now by clicking here
We've also got a preview of our Interactive GM Walkthrough...
Play through the walkthrough preview for a chance to win a special bonus!
And check out all the stretch goals we've unlocked...
Which pledge level should you choose? The $20 Completionist Level is the best value, but here's the full list of options:
Pledge $20 or more and get a special bonus on all future Burning Yeti Kickstarter projects!
What is The Lost Dungeons of Xon?
The Lost Dungeons of Xon is an original series of tabletop roleplaying modules designed to be inserted into any campaign world. It tells the story of the sorcerer Xon, who was banished by the other members of his order when his ambition and power became too great. Centuries later, he has returned from exile and is looking to reclaim the underground fortresses and dungeons he constructed long ago. However, many of his strongholds have been overrun by creatures of the wild or taken over by power-seeking factions. With only a fraction of his former power intact, Xon needs help.

This Kickstarter presents "The Crucible", a module where Xon puts several teams of adventurers to the test to find a party worthy enough to aid him. Whether his purposes are for good or for ill remains to be seen; The Lost Dungeons of Xon is an evolving story where the motivations of the heroes and villains are shaped by the choices and actions of the players. Nothing is as it seems. An NPC slated to be a villain could end up being a hero instead.

What systems will the module support?

The Lost Dungeons of Xon features full support for three popular roleplaying systems:
Pathfinder
5th Edition
Old School 1st Edition
Each system will be supported with its own PDF, which will include both system-specific stats as well as guidelines in the text. For example, only the 5th Edition PDF will reference rules such as Advantage, while the Old School version will be geared more toward combat and non-skill-based problem-solving.
In what format will the module be available?
Because our module is designed specifically to leverage the capabilities of e-publishing, it will only be available in interactive PDF format. This PDF will have many advanced features, including:
Landscape format for optimized use on laptops and tablets
Easy navigation to "pop-up" stat blocks by clicking on an NPC or monster’s name
Quick links from the dungeon map to room and encounter descriptions
Hyperlinks to external spell and monster stats
Professionally-narrated embedded audio
Password-unlockable player content
What makes The Lost Dungeons of Xon different from other modules? 

All of the dungeons presented in the series are what we call pre-build friendly; the heroes will know the layout of the dungeon in advance. But even with some of Xon's secrets at their disposal, new surprises await them. For the dungeon master, this allows you to present the layout of the dungeon to the players right from the start of the session without spoiling the module.    
The Lost Dungeons are designed specifically to make use of two very successful Kickstarter campaigns: Dwarven Forge's Game Tiles and Reaper's Bones Miniatures. If you own either or both of these accessories, the module provides you with specific guidelines on which tiles and/or miniatures to use, including video tutorials showing you precisely how to set up the dungeon. If you don't own them, the PDF will also include printable maps and character stand-ups.
Instead of commissioning traditional fantasy artwork, our modules feature high-resolution photography of professionally-painted miniatures and three-dimensional dungeons for a unique look and feel.
Why is the campaign running for 60 days?

The main reason we’re Kickstarting the first Lost Dungeons module is to build a community. How many backers we get will determine whether or not we’re able to continue the series with additional modules. The more backers, the better the chances of a successful follow-up.

If you want to see The Lost Dungeons of Xon succeed beyond just this initial campaign, help us put the word out. Post on roleplaying forums and Reddit. Share a link to our Kickstarter on Twitter and Facebook. If you have a podcast you enjoy, let them know about our campaign. The more people we can spread the word to, the more likely we’ll be able to produce additional modules. With sixty days, we hope to give everyone who's interested the opportunity to jump on board.

What do I get for my pledge?
This Kickstarter is for “The Crucible”, the first module in what we plan to be an extended series of modules. The Crucible is a 25-page standalone module for 4 to 6 first-level characters, designed to be run during a single 3- to 4-hour game session.
For as little as $1, you’ll receive the entire Crucible module in the supported game system of your choice, along with a companion Digital Player’s Guide that includes background information, maps and clues for the players.
If you pledge at the $5 Adventurer level, you’ll also receive extended character write-ups for the more prominent NPC’s in the game, with enough information and stats to use them in other games if you desire.
At the $10 Storyteller of Valoria level, you'll get everything from the Adventurer level plus an additional full-length module set in Dwarven Forge's original setting, the City of Valoria. 
* BEST DEAL * At the $20 Completionist level, you will also receive a special side quest "Moving Dungeon" module exclusive to this Kickstarter, as well as PDFs in all three formats. You'll also get every unlocked stretch goal and add-on, including the Valoria module, at no extra cost! That's an over $50 retail value for a pledge of just $20. What's more, if you back any of our future projects, you'll get  a special bonus.
We've also got the $30 Citizen of Therigard pledge level that lets you name an NPC (in addition to everything in the Completionist level) and the ultimate pledge of $100, which gets you entrance into the Burning Yeti Inner Circle, where you can get directly involved with the development and testing of our content.
*City of Valoria is created and copyrighted by Dwarven Forge, LLC
Unless noted otheriwse, unlocked stretch goals will be available to anyone who backs at the $5 level or higher.
Stretch Goals
UNLOCKED! The Barroom Brawl supplement will be free to all Adventurer-level backers or higher. It will offer a plethora of options (yes, we said plethora) to flesh out and expand an optional encounter in The Crucible, or it can be used separately from the module, to add spice to any game.
UNLOCKED! All backers at the Adventurer-level and higher will receive Pre-generated player characters to go with the supported system of your choice. These PCs will be a fully-fleshed out and diverse crew of characters, ready to drop into The Lost Dungeons of Xon or any other game.
*Wilds of Therigard addon is included free with $20 Completionist-level pledge
UNLOCKED! The Wilds of Therigard will detail the region around the town and the dungeon where the module takes place. It will also include a bonus cave encounter that can be constructed using Dwarven Forge's Caverns tiles, or printed using our high-rez printer-friendly map.
UNLOCKED! We're going to make special jpg and png versions of our maps and NPCs designed specifically for use with virtual tabletop programs like Roll20. These files will be available on our website, free to ALL backers.
UNLOCKED! FREE to all backers at the Adventurer level or higher! We'll make a special prequel adventure designed specifically to be run as a prelude to The Crucible. How does the road to the hero's journey begin? Now you'll get your chance to find out...
UNLOCKED! We'll expand both the Digital Player's Guide and the Shifting Dungeon with additional content, including "The Broken Door" encounter. (The Shifting Dungeon is exclusive to Completionist-level backers only.)
UNLOCKED! The Adventurer's Guide to Therigard will fully detail the town itself, including a bevy of additional NPC's. This add-on will be available to all Adventurer-level backers for an additional $5, or FREE to all Completionist-level backers. 
And as a special bonus... We'll give Therigard the full three-dimensional treatment, building out the town using pieces from Dwarven Forge's City Builder tiles.
UNLOCKED! We're developing a web-based, interactive version of The Crucible that lets you go through the entire module from start to finish. You'll face many of the same decisions you'll ultimately be presenting to your players. What better way to prepare for a module than to have a chance to play it yourself?
UNLOCKED! We'll add more professional audio to the module in the form of embedded sound effects and ambient backgrounds and music. This upgrade will be FREE to all backers!
UNLOCKED! Now that we've reached 500 backers, we'll give our Adventurer's Guide to Therigard add-on the full City Builder treatment, including photos of the constructed town and instructional videos on how to put together each of the buildings in the town using City Builder pieces.
UNLOCKED! Grubfinkel's Map Guide, a series of encounter ideas for use in any campaign setting (system neutral). These assorted underground locales will be built out with Dwarven Forge tiles (but also useable without them). Each map will have notes from the veteran spelunker, Grubfinkel, to give you ideas to build out a full encounter. And for every additional 50 backers we get, from now through the end of the campaign, we'll add another encounter idea!
*Available to Valoria-level and Completionist-level backers
 UNLOCKED! We're pleased to announce that we will be working in conjunction with the folks over at Dwarven Forge to develop a special module set in their original setting, the City of Valoria. This module will be of a similar scope and length to the main module in our campaign, and in addition to all our interactive bells and whistles, it will feature tiles from Dwarven Forge's City Builder campaign. Like The Crucible, this module will be available for 1st Edition, 5th Edition and Pathfinder.
UNLOCKED! Now that we've reached the big $10k, we'll add quality fantasy artwork to supplement our photography.
UNLOCKED! We're going to add more professionally narrated audio to The Crucible and to our interactive walkthroughs. More room descriptions, more dialogue, more tone-setting awesomeness.
UNLOCKED! We'll enhance the Interactive GM Walkthrough with enough features to turn it into a "Playthrough." We'll add more character class options and stats. And while the mechanics won't be system specific, there will be d20-based skill checks and combat rolls. All of these enhancements will improve the interactive experience and increase re-playability.
UNLOCKED! We'll build the Therigard Almanac, an interactive online repository of all the people, places and things you might run across in The Lost Dungeons modules and all companion setting materials. This will be a wiki-style setup that will be a handy reference for GM's, and players will also be able to use it keep track of their own notes and encounters.
What is Burning Yeti Studios?
Burning Yeti Studios is a group of highly experienced gamers and creative professionals with a proven record in the gaming and publishing industries.
Jeff Hannes previously worked as Senior Editor for InQuest Gamer magazine and has written material for Iron Crown Enterprises and Wizards of the Coast. 
Michael Searle is Burning Yeti's graphic designer. He was Executive Editor of InQuest Gamer and has written over 50 published strategy guides for video games.
Dave Breen is the owner of GameKnight Products, Inc. and has launched three successful Kickstarter campaigns selling custom chips designed specifically for gamers. 
Joel Lytle is a former owner of the All About Games! retail store.
No Surprises Section
While we will endeavor to ensure that all the features of our interactive PDFs work on as many platforms as possible, it’s still a relatively recent technology. We do extensive testing, but we can’t always account for certain versions of software and operating systems. To fully utilize the features of the PDFs, you may have to download a new version of Adobe Reader to your laptop, desktop or tablet, or install the latest system updates for your device.
Due to the interactive nature of the PDF, the GM should plan to have a computer or tablet on hand to run the module. If the players have technology as well, their experience can be enhanced by using the Digital Player's Guides, but they are not required. All the information in the player's guides will also be available as printable content.
Also, note that embedded audio will not work on most tablet PDF Readers, but the PDF will contain clickable links to play the audio off of our website, and all narration audio files will be available as mp3 downloads.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any creative endeavor, the biggest challenge will be delivering the items on time. Fortunately, we’ve already put a great deal of effort into "The Crucible", and the module itself is nearly complete.

The remaining materials (including bonus materials and stretch goals) will need to be completed, designed and, most importantly, play-tested. While we’ve allotted an appropriate amount of time for play-testing in our production schedule, there is always the possibility that player feedback could necessitate changes. In the unlikely event that happens, a delay might be unavoidable.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
UPDATE JANUARY 27: Thanks for an incredible Kickstarter. We have closed out all 13 stretch goals. (Wow, that's an unlucky number! I guess it's appropriate for Grimtooth.) Thanks to everyone for their support on this wild ride. It's been a great experience and we can't wait until you see Grimtooth's Ultimate Traps Collection printed in all its glory. And with that, we officially close this Kickstarter!
All right humans, this is your chance to own the 460-page hardcover compilation of all five of my systems-neutral Grimtooth’s Traps books – plus loads of extras! We’re talking 500+ traps and maybe me making a guest appearance in a Dungeon Crawl Classics crossover module. I’m Grimtooth the Troll, and I’ll be your guide on this Kickstarter tour, so gird your loins, get your dice and let me tell you a tale…
This is what the humans at Goodman Games say you need to know about this Kickstarter event: 
Published by Goodman Games under license from Flying Buffalo (and with my permission), this 460-page hardcover collects of all five of MY Traps books, including the original eponymous 1981 edition as well as Traps Too, Traps Fore, Traps Ate, and Traps Lite. Every trap from the original five Grimtooth’s books is included – there are no exclusions!
This massive tome is systems-neutral, containing more than 500 traps suitable for all fantasy systems and games. You have never had so many trap options before – use them well…
My book will be available to you mortals in multiple formats: a basic softcover for table play, a durable hardcover for longer shelf life, and a gold foil edition for the serious collector (available in both faux and real leather, and with a slipcase).
The book is also available in PDF edition. All print backers will also receive a copy of the PDF edition.
Face it – this is a homage to a VERY important piece of gaming history. (Mine!) The book features a foreword by noted dungeon designer Harley Stroh, and also includes an extensive interview with the original creative team, a cover gallery showcasing 30 years of editions (in both English and many foreign languages), and a look behind the mysterious submission process – including my legendary “Grimtooth’s Submissions Box” that sits majestically on a shelf in the Flying Buffalo offices.
And I have created more than a dozen new traps specifically for this volume. For the first time in a decade, the Grimtooth’s submissions box has been cracked opened again, and more great entries have poured out to an unsuspecting world!
Plus the humans at Goodman Games are giving you the possibility of several exciting stretch goals to make this epic project even more impressive: printed endsheets, a satin ribbon bookmark, the cover gallery in full color, a custom dust jacket for KS backers, and a gatefold page featuring the Grimtooth board game that was first mentioned more than 20 years ago!
And if you’re really lucky we might do a cross-over with the Dungeon Crawl Classics line, allowing me (Grimtooth) to make an appearance in a special DCC module produced just for this Kickstarter!
And to wrap it all up, primary Grimtooth illustrator Steve Crompton has dug through his archives to find original art from the earliest books. This original art is available as part of the deluxe book pledge levels!
Listen bub, here’s the bottom line - Grimtooth’s Ultimate Traps Collection: A gigantic collection of over 500 awesome engines of destruction, delver dicers, character crushers, adventurer anxieties, minion munchers, hero harangers, general tricks, traps and other rare and dangerous items for use in defending game master treasures! You want it and you need it.  And if you don’t order one, I’ll have to hunt you down!
Now as hard as this is to believe, there may be a few of you out there living in a shack in the middle of Mohave Desert, that haven’t actually seen one of my original Traps books. If you are one of those unenlightened souls, read the paragraph that follows. (The rest of you can click that button over on the right and get your pledge in.)
What is Grimtooth’s Traps? Originally published by Flying Buffalo, Grimtooth’s Traps is one of the most popular RPG accessories ever produced, with more than 250,000 copies in print since 1981. There have been a total of seven Grimtooth’s books produced, and all of them are usable with any RPG. Five of the seven volumes were traps-focused, and for the first time ever, these magnificent engines of player-character destruction are collected in an officially-licensed hardback collector’s volume suitable for both presentation and play. If you play any fantasy role playing game, of any edition, this collection will challenge your players in ways they will never see coming! (All right, you got it now?  Let’s move on…)
OK, so what’s in my new book? Grimtooth’s Ultimate Traps Collection contains the following:
Exact reproductions of Grimtooth’s Traps, Traps Too, Traps Fore, Traps Ate, and Traps Lite. These five books are scanned from the recent printed editions and collected together in one volume. Collectively these comprise 400+ pages and more than 500 traps.
A foreword by dungeon designer Harley Stroh, author of dozens of Dungeon Crawl Classics adventures.
An interview with the original Grimtooth’s design team of Steve Crompton, Rick Loomis, Paul Ryan O’Connor, and Bear Peters, conducted by Jim Wampler. Learn the perspective of the original creators as to why this book was such a milestone when it came on to the scene as the first book of traps in the industry’s history, and one of the very first RPG supplements to be written “in-character.” Oh…and of course they interviewed me as well.  After all, I am the most important thing about these books.
A look at the submissions process. For more than three decades, a dusty box atop Rick Loomis’ file cabinet in the Flying Buffalo headquarters has housed the flood of traps submissions. As longtime fans know, many of the original Grimtooth traps were submitted by the general public. This mysterious box is finally documented in photographic form, and several traps that started as fan submissions are shown in their original “fan letter” submission form prior to publication. Then the submissions box is opened up and, for the first time since the late 1990’s, the contents are reviewed and fan-submitted traps are selected for publication! Which leads to…
…New traps! A bonus traps chapter includes a selection of new, never-before-seen, recently-discovered tragic tricks, devious devices, fearsome foes, complicated calamities and sneaky scenarios from the one and only Grimtooth! (That’s me!) These are collected from fan submissions, as well as new contributions by veteran Grimtooth collaborators, including Ken St. Andre, creator of Tunnels & Trolls.
The Grimtooth’s Traps board game. It's a silly idea based on the Candyland concept, and a fun warm-up game while you’re waiting for your RPG group to show up. Originally a seed idea in a 1990’s Grimtooth brainstorming session, this design is now finally fleshed out. With sufficient funding the board game will be presented as a gatefold page so you can actually fold out the board and play Grimtooth’s Game of Traps from the book!
Cover art gallery. Did you know my Grimtooth’s Traps has been translated into French, German, and even Swedish? And the original Traps has been through seven slightly different editions, with a number of cover variations? With sufficient funding, this cover gallery will be presented in full color!
And other behind-the-scenes ephemera. A variety of rare art (including the first publication ever of the Jeff Dee line art used for the cover of Traps Too), a complete index of all five traps volumes, an accounting of every Grimtooth’s print run, and more fun things to better acquaint us all with the history of the Grimtooth family.
Let me show you what you’re getting here, chum… Here are three PDF previews of the book:
The first 10 trap pages of the original Grimtooth’s Traps.The book that started it all!
Behind the scenes: An excerpt from the interview with the original creators.
The making of a trap: As we uncover the mysterious box of submissions for Grimtooth’s Traps, we also include some examples of fan letters and how they were answered by me (and in some cases, turned into published material). Here’s an excerpt.
The book is 460 pages long – so that ought to be plenty, even for you greedy humans.
By the way, this book is done and ready to be printed! My slaves have already completed this great project.  The content for the book is written, edited, illustrated, and laid out. What remains is the printing, and that’s where you humans come in. My associates at Goodman Games have set the funding goal to print in hardcover with Smythe-sewn binding. This is a durable process where the spine is actually sewn to the pages, not just glued as with many RPG products. (There’s nothing like sewing a spine into your book!) This binding will last for decades of use. With sufficient funding we can offer a variety of formats, as well as the specialized production values outlined as stretch goals below!
Add-On Copies of the Dungeon Crawl Classics / Grimtooth Crossover: Based on the stretch goals achieved so far, we will be creating a Dungeon Crawl Classics module featuring Grimtooth. This will be given in PDF form to all backers. If you would like a print version, add $10 to your pledge! 
Tell me about the stretch goals (I love that term…): Certainly! A 460-page hardcover book of my peerless prose and ingenious designs is impressive on its own. But in addition, we’d like to include these features (assuming enough of you bribe us sufficiently):
At $23,000, printed endsheets. FUNDED! The endsheets are the 11”x17” pages that are on the inside board of a hardcover. We’d like to print these with scenes of Grimtooth, Grimtina, and their nefarious deeds. (An extra picture of me and Grimtina?  This is a must-have!)
At $27,000, a gatefold page with Grimtooth’s Game of Traps. FUNDED! The Grimtooth’s board game requires an 11”x17” page to properly display. At this funding level we will include a fold-out page (a gatefold) in the hardcover so you can read about the board game, then fold out the next page to actually play it!
Grimtooth's Game of Traps!
At $32,000, color cover gallery: FUNDED! The 8-page cover gallery in the hardcover will be printed in full color, allowing a better representation of the history of Grimtooth’s covers in both English and a variety of other languages. (See Traps history in full, bloody color!)
More than 30 years of covers, in a variety of languages!
At $38,000, a satin ribbon bookmark bound into the hardcover spine: FUNDED! Because with 500+ traps, sometimes you need to save your place. (My sister Grimtina insisted on this idea, so here it is.) Maybe we'll even throw in two bookmarks. Because with 500+ traps, sometimes you need to remember where two traps are! (And my sister likes satin.)
At $45,000, a Grimtooth art print: FUNDED! Who says trolls can't be attractive? Decorate your gamer den with this 8.5"x11" fine print of a classic Grimtooth trap image, which will arrive tucked inside the cover of the hardcover.
At $53,000, a Kickstarter-exclusive retro dust jacket: FUNDED! At this level, all hardcovers fulfilled as part of the Kickstarter will be wrapped in a dust jacket with a retro design that resembles the very first printing of Grimtooth’s Traps – the original “gray cover” edition, with blue line art on a gray background. (Use it to protect this precious tome!)
The original Grimtooth's Traps cover -- inspiration for our retro dust jacket goal!
At $62,000, a Dungeon Crawl Classics module featuring Grimtooth: FUNDED! It’s the collaboration you’ve always wanted: a dungeon crawl into Grimtooth’s own domain. Co-written by Dungeon Crawl Classics author Jobe Bittman and primary Grimtooth illustrator Steve Crompton, this DCC module will be produced “in the DCC style” and distributed in PDF form to all hardcover backers at this funding level.  (Don’t worry, though. I’ll be throwing in my suggestions and stellar commentary as well.)
At $98,000, a color poster of Grimtina included in the book. FUNDED! As announced by Grimtina herself in her recent surprise update!
At $100,000, we will expand the PDF edition of Grimtooth’s Ultimate Traps (which all backers already receive) to also include Traps Bazaar and Dungeon of Doom. FUNDED! There is a considerable amount of back-end scanning and cleanup work involved in getting this material ready, and we’ll get started on that work the moment we pass $100k.
At $110,000, we will insert an 11”x17” folded cardboard game-board into the book: FUNDED! So you can more easily play the Grimtooth’s Traps Board Game! An actual “board” for the game, if you will. On the back will be game cards and other materials to photocopy and use in play! The gatefold pages will still be included, and this game board should make it easier to actually play.
At $115,000, we will upgrade all gold foil and leatherbound editions to include approximately +80 pages of Traps Bazaar! FUNDED! The softcover and “regular” hardcover will still be the existing 460 pages, but all gold foil and leatherbound editions will get an extra ~80 pages at no additional cost beyond the existing pledge cost!
At $120,000, we will manufacture a custom-printed, illustrated, corrugated shipping box to deliver the books in. FUNDED! Some of you saw what we did with the Metamorphosis Alpha shipping box – this will be similar. It’s a really fun way to get a package in the mail, and will only be available to backers of this Kickstarter.
At $130,000, we will upgrade all gold foil and leatherbound editions to include the extra +160 pages of Traps Bazaar and Dungeon of Doom! FUNDED! The softcover and “regular” hardcover will still be the existing 460 pages, but all gold foil and leatherbound editions will get an extra 160 pages at no additional cost beyond the existing pledge cost!
What’s beyond that? Don’t worry, we have even more ideas for awesome stretch goals! We’d like to print the DCC module and tuck it inside the hardcover for all backers. We’d love to include a full-length poster of the lovely Grimtina (and maybe her brother Grimtooth) and tuck that poster folded-up inside the back of every hardcover. And I’m sure you have ideas too – as the project rolls along we’ll solicit your feedback. Let’s blow away all the stretch goals and get into the really fun territory of “what else can we add to this thing?”
I suppose you’ll want to know the pledge levels. No doubt this book will be used in different ways by you humans. Some GMs will use it in games, some readers will use it to reminisce, and some collectors will never open it. Therefore, I’ve ordered Goodman Games to offer several options for pledge levels, which are listed at right. They include softcover, hardcover, gold foil hardcover, slipcased edition, real leather edition -- and even some versions with autograph pages and original art!
Shipping & handling: Shipping and handling charges will be invoiced at the end of the Kickstarter. This allows us to give you the best price for your order. We will invoice the orders via Paypal when items are ready to ship. For USA orders, orders will be shipped via media mail at an expected cost of approximately $5-8, depending on final weight of product. International shipping charges can vary widely. If you are unsure how expensive international shipping can be, please ask us for an estimate.
SHOW YOUR SUPPORT! Use the backer image below for your profile!
So there you are – what are you waiting for? Start pledging, or I’ll send Spike the Grimdog to come “fetch” you…

updates.update_userinfo: OCR Edition of Grimtooth's Ultimate Traps Collection
updates.update_content:
Hello, Grimtooth fans!
We realize it's been a couple years since this Kickstarter ended, but you're getting one last reward. We have uploaded an OCR text edition of Grimtooth's Ultimate Traps Collection. What does that mean? Well, the first publication of this book was based on scans of the original Grimtooth books. Because those scans are images, you can't copy-paste the text, or even search the text.
We've now created a version where the scanned images of the original books have been converted to recognizable text via Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technology. For you as a reader, this means you can now search for the title of your favorite trap, and find it quickly!

All right, last time I promised you a taste of the wonders waiting for you in Trapsylvania.

A Trapsylvania Update
By Grimtooth, the Troll of Trolls
Yes, the time has come and I have emerged once again from the depths of my underground cavern complex. You may all rejoice or tremble as appropriate. Now on to why I have returned...

campaign.story:
WILDERNESS ADVENTURES is an all-new outdoor terrain series that allows you to create fully modular 28mm scale outdoor terrain for your RPG or war-game, and features our exclusive FOLD-FLAT system for many of the larger models. Each set is delivered in a downloadable PDF format via our online distribution partner DriveThruRPG.com, and once you have the set, you can print and build as many pieces as you like and never run out or need to purchase more. Additionally, our graphic layer options allow you to customize your terrain to suit your tastes. This new wilderness terrain series is the culmination of ten years of gaming terrain design experience. 
By supporting us through Kickstarter, you get exclusive textures, bonus models that won't be available later, and access to free stretch rewards. We have been in business for ten years, and have successfully delivered five previous Kickstarter projects, so you can pledge with confidence that we will deliver a high quality product on time. 
Stretch rewards that will increase the size of the terrain offerings will be FREE for everyone who pledges at the 'Adventurer' level or higher, so spread the word about this project to your friends, post about it on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc., and GET FREE BONUS MODELS as the pledges rise! 
All miniatures shown in our video and promotional shots are by Reaper Miniatures (www.reapermini.com)
Below is a selection of sample images from these terrain sets and previous releases to show the level of detail featured in our products.
Cliff models from the 'Highlands' set.

Stretch Reward Descriptions:

Sphinx: A full 3D giant Sphinx statue will be included in the desert set! 
Forest Ruins: A set of collapsable ruins will be included in the Woodlands set! 
Goblin Camp: This set will include tents make of animal skins, poles with heads/skulls, prisoner cages, and more!

3D Giant Boars: Your orc minis can ride them!
Fairy Ring: Mushroom fairy rings, various sizes.

Wilderness Traps: Various traps made from natural surroundings!

Risks and challenges
Fat Dragon Games is a small company, and we need to be careful what subjects we choose to proceed with for production. One or two poorly selling sets would hurt our company severely. By putting potential projects up on Kickstarter, we can be sure if there is demand for that subject before devoting our resources to it. We also get to connect directly with our customers, rewarding those who are early supporters for a set with cool stuff like exclusive textures and features not available to customers who purchase the set later on. We have been in business for ten years, having released over one hundred and forty terrain sets, and have had five previous Kickstarter campaigns successfully funded and delivered, so supporters of this project can feel completely confident in our ability to deliver a high quality product as promised.
